citation.article-title: Actinophytocola xinjiangensis sp. nov., isolated from virgin forest soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinophytocola xinjiangensis sp. nov.
Actinophytocola xinjiangensis (xin.jiang.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. xinjiangensis pertaining to Xinjiang, a province of north-west China, the source of the type strain).
Good growth occurs on ISP 3, ISP 4, modified Bennett’s agar and N-Z-amine medium, on which beige to yellowish brown colonies and a non-fragmented substrate mycelium with occasional septa are formed.
Scant aerial hyphae are produced on ISP 3, ISP 4, ISP 5 and ISP 9.
The aerial mycelium fragments into short spore chains with cylindrical spores.
Greyish-black diffusion pigments are produced on ISP 7.
Growth occurs at pH 6.0–9.0 (optimum pH 8.0) and at 10–30 °C (optimum 25–30 °C).
The maximum NaCl concentration for growth is 4 % (w/v).

Positive for catalase, reduction of nitrate, liquefaction of gelatin, peptonization of milk and decomposition of casein, hypoxanthine, starch and urea, but negative for production of H2S and decomposition of adenine, guanine, l-tyrosine and xanthine.

Utilizes adonitol, l-arabinose, cellobiose, dextrin, d-fructose, galactose, d-glucose, glycogen, glycerol, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose and d-xylose as sole carbon sources, but not inositol, lactose, melezitose, raffinose, salicin or turanose.

Produces acid from l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-glucose, maltose, l-rhamnose and ribose, but not from adonitol, d-fructose, galactose, inositol, lactose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melezitose, raffinose, sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose or d-xylose.
Whole-cell hydrolysates contain meso-diaminopimelic acid, arabinose, galactose, glucose, ribose and rhamnose (trace).
The diagnostic phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, hydroxyphosphatidylethanolamine and ninhydrin-positive phosphoglycolipids.
The major fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, iso-C14 : 0, iso-C16 : 1 H and C17 : 1ω6c.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-10(H2) and MK-9(H4).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 72.5 mol%.
The type strain, QAIII60T ( = CGMCC 4.4663T = NBRC 106673T), was isolated from virgin forest soil of Kanas Nature Reserve, Xinjiang, north-west China.
